job_description:
• Basic understanding of programming concepts with experience writing simple programs in at least one language.
• Identify product-specific testing requirements and build specialized tests for newly identified fail modes.
• Strong collaboration and teamwork skills with the ability to support cross-functional growth.
• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering.
• Monitor product yields and implement corrective actions as needed.
• Prior experience in a related engineering role.
• Develop data analysis software and methods to improve accessibility and usability of technical product data.
• Partner with Quality Assurance to ensure product quality and reliability meet industry standards.

• Ability to work 12-hour shifts (3 on/4 off and 4 on/3 off) with the need to stand the entire shift and lift equipment Education in industry-related associate degree.
• Working towards a STEM-related degree.
• Equivalent military training and experience.
• Equivalent work experience Demonstrated expertise in mechatronics, robotics, foundational electrical concepts, technical writing, electrical power systems, and statics Basic PC skills including MS Office Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
• Basic understanding of SPC principles and accurate application Rebuild manufacturing equipment as needed Prior semiconductor experience Less than 2 years.
• Fundamental to intermediate understanding of AC/DC circuits, encompassing electricity basics, as well as fundamental electronic components and circuits.
• Applied knowledge of mathematical concepts and problem-solving at least into an algebraic level Flexible with job responsibilities and shift assignments including night shift.
